newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong stocks seen recovering on overseas gains.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks seen recovering on overseas gains.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are seen recovering on Friday from Thursday's sharp fall following Wall Street's record close overnight and better performances by local stocks listed in London, brokers said.

"Hong Kong stocks have fallen five days in a row and are oversold," said Andrew To, dealing director at OSK Asia Securities. "It should warrant a rebound of between 200-300 points today following better showings in New York and London."
The Hang Seng Index tumbled 497.18 points, or 3.45 percent, to 13,924.34 on Thursday. Later the Hong Kong London Reference Index of Hong Kong shares rose 161.06 points to 14,085.40.
